thread.title: Dean Smith: Kieron Morris improving each week
thread.title_full: Dean Smith: Kieron Morris improving each week

title: Dean Smith: Kieron Morris improving each week
text:
The 21-year-old was handed only his second league start of the season and was involved in most of what the Saddlers were able to create in their impressive north-west outing. 
His only other league start previously came in August’s win at Rochdale. 
The Banks’s chief said: 
“It was tough, they played three at the back and he was our out ball for the majority of the first-half.” 
Smith noted that, because of the high standards that the former Wrexham loanee sets himself that he was surprised not to see the net bulge. 
He said: “We only spotted him a few times but he’s a lad that wants to go and score goals but he’ll be a bit disappointed with that. 
“There was one in the first half where he has worked the keeper and in training they usually go in. 
“He’s doing well and he’s improving each week.” 
While Morris keeps working hard to be a firm fixture of Smith’s future plans, one player who is very much part of the boss’ past is former favourite Will Grigg. What do you think? Log in and start commenting 
The 24-year-old, who moved on to Brentford from the Banks’s before a successful loan spell at MK Dons led to a £1million move to Wigan, lined up against a number of former team-mates on Saturday. 
The Northern Ireland international was the subject of loud jeers from the away end which quickly turned to ironic cheers as the striker missed a couple of clear-cut second-half opportunities. 
But Grigg’s former boss wants to credit the Walsall youth system for producing that level of player. 
Smith said:
